page.title: 14NORTH KYME C.P. SCHOOL
page.content: The school is over 100 years old. The original building is now our hall. There were two cottages one was the schools and one was MR.W.Gray.The school house was joined on to the old school and was sold in 1983 to MR. Robinson.The first building was destroyed by fire on May 20th1952 the present classrooms were erected to replace them allthe old records were burned.There are 47 children at present.There are 2\ permanent teachers.Mrs Williamson has been the headteacher here for 8 years. Some of our school activities include swimmimg each week at R.A.F.Cranwell pool, football and postball, recorder lessons and athletics.We have a Parent Teachers Association which raises money for new equipment and school outings.
